column3: I don't think we want it showing full bars when a user only has the maximum outbound connections.  Not having full bars is pretty much the only UI incentive we create for people to get their inbound connections working.\n
@gmaxwell nails it, the current behavior is intended. This does not "fix" anything.\n

The idea is OK though, as it's more general, in that when MAX_OUTBOUND_CONNECTIONS changes the icon will still be correct.

But make sure that the "full" icon only shows when there are _more_ than the maximum number of outbound connections.

Alternative option would be to track the number of outgoing and incoming connections separately and show a special icon when there are incoming connection

I was under the impression that this was only outbound connections.  Now that I have turned off my firewall, I see that I have more than 8 connections.  Maybe the tool-tip could be changed to indicate inbound and outbound connections with a hint about port forwarding if there are no inbound connections?\n
Yes, you could also do it the other way around and show a warning when there are no inbound connections. Many torrent clients do it that way.\n

I'd prefer to not bludgeon people _too much_ about inbound connections.  Basically I want to encourage people to get inbound working when its easy for them to do so, but not have them worry about it if it's hard... and I certainly don't want to deal with a bunch of tech support burden. 'zomg my inbound isn't working' \n
Right, viewed like that, it's fine the way it is. It's visible but very subtle. Closing the issue.\n
